sponsor: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
briefTitle: Trial of the Rapid Antisuicidal Effects of Intranasal Ketamine in Comorbid Depression and Alcohol Abuse
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial of the Rapid Antisuicidal Effects of Intranasal Ketamine in Comorbid Depression and Alcohol Abuse
summary: This project aims to evaluate the potential rapid and sustained antisuicidal and antidepressant effects of a single intranasal dose of ketamine in inpatients during a mood episode in Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) or Bipolar Disorder (BD) with or without comorbid recent abuse of alcohol.

primaryOutcome.measure: Suicidal Ideation as Assessed by the Scale for Suicide Ideation (SSI)
